Data: Phangiso to Smith, 2 runs pitched up and that is whipped away towards deep midwicket, Smith charges down the track before playing that shot, and immediately called for two
Phangiso to Smith, no run backs away and looks to chop the ball off the back foot, bottom edge bounces through to the keeper
Phangiso to Smith, no run turns away after pitching on a length, Smith pushes forward at it, off the outside edge towards gully

Phangiso to Smith, 2 runs similar to the first ball of this over, Smith again skates down the track and stylishly sends the ball towards deep midwicket, it is not as far away from the fielder as the previous one, Hughes has to scramble back to make his gorund
Phangiso to Smith, no run some bounce there and doesn't turn away either, Smith is beaten by that one
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run tucked towards midwicket for a single
Morkel to Smith, no run just outside off, pushed towards point
Morkel to Smith, no run well outside off, Smith reaches out and taps the ball towards point
Morkel to Smith, 1 run the typical Morne Morkel length, well outside off, slapped towards point, du Plessis attempts a diving one-handed stop but can only deflect the ball towards cover
Morkel to Hughes, 2 runs angling in towards middle and off, Hughes stays in the crease and clips the ball in front of square leg
Morkel to Hughes, 2 runs short of length and angling in, tapped towards deep midwicket for a couple, brings up another half-century, at a run a ball
Morkel to Hughes, 1 run fuller and outside off, Morkel continues from round the wicket, guided behind backward point

Phangiso to Hughes, no run from over the wicket, Hughes pokes the ball towards point., he takes a step before deciding against the single, Smith had already taken off, and has to sprint back, Phangiso had already broken the stumps earlier, so a direct hit wouldn't have counted
Phangiso to Hughes, no run pushed towards mid-on
Phangiso to Hughes, 1 run pitched up and that is clipped towards midwicket for a single
Phangiso to Smith, no run spinning away just a touch after pitching on off, guided towards point
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run outside off, stabbed towards backward point after making some room
Phangiso to Hughes, 1 run length ball, Hughes skips out of the crease and guides the ball towards long-on
Morkel to Hughes, no run Morkel cramps up Hughes from round the wicket, this ball is angling in and on the stumps, Hughes still wants to cut it, he can't, the ball drops at his feet
Morkel to Hughes, no run a bit more width this time, slapped towards backward point
Morkel to Hughes, 1 run angling in once more, back of a length ball, towards third man
Morkel to Smith, 1 run length ball from over the wicket, worked towards midwicket for a single
Morkel to Hughes, 1 run bit of width, Hughes likes it there, thumps this towards sweeper cover for a single
Morkel to Smith, 1 wide short ball, slower as well, Smith shapes to hook but that is well above head height, Smith lets it go
Morkel to Smith, 2 runs overpitched outside off, a wristy whip sends the ball past midwicket
Phangiso to Hughes, no run spinning in from round the wicket, guided towards short fine leg
Phangiso to Hughes, 1 run length ball is swept firmly, along the ground, towards deep square
Phangiso to Smith, no run nudges this one towards backward square leg
Phangiso to Smith, no run skips down the track, Phangiso drops it shorter, defended by Smith
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run full ball on the pads, eased towards long-on for one
Phangiso to Hughes, no run gets out of the crease to get near the pitch of the ball, can only push this length ball towards mid-on, no run
Morkel to Smith, 1 leg bye banged in short, Smith goes for the pull, he doesn't connect and is hit on the shoulder

Morkel to Hughes, SIX runs short ball is pulled away... will that be caught at deep square leg, would have been if the fielder was on the rope, instead he is ten yards in, and the ball clears him and just clears the rope, it was McLaren in the deep
Morkel to Hughes, 1 run
Morkel to Smith, no run short of length ball heading for middle, Smith wants to work that to the leg side, but he can only defend to the right of the bowler
Morkel to Smith, no run blocked to the off side this time
Morkel to Smith, no run short of length ball on off stump, defended towards cover this time
Phangiso to Hughes, no run defended towards silly point
Phangiso to Hughes, no run turning towards the pads, defended to the leg side
Phangiso to Hughes, no run tucked towards midwicket this time, three dots to start the over
Phangiso to Hughes, 1 run length ball was drifting down, tucked towards square leg for a single
Phangiso to Smith, 1 run length ball spins away, Smith plays it inside-out towards long-off after taking a couple of paces down the track
Phangiso to Hughes, 1 run tossed up, on a length, it is Hughes was dances down the pitch this time, eases the ball to long-on
Tahir to Hughes, 2 runs gives this some air, plenty of air, it ends up as a high full toss, swatted towards deep midwicket, really should have got a boundary off that rubbish delivery
Tahir to Hughes, no run defended towards point by Hughes
Tahir to Hughes, no run spinning in from a length, turning towards off, slapped back towards the bowler
Tahir to Hughes, 1 run swept to deep backward square leg for a single
Tahir to Smith, no run spins away outside off, steered to backward point off the back foot
Tahir to Smith, no run flatter, quicker one, shortish and Smith can only defend that after charging down the track
Steyn to Hughes, 1 leg bye short of length ball on the pads, can't get bat on it, the ball rolls towards square leg for a leg-bye
Steyn to Smith, 1 run short of length ball is punched towards sweeper cover for a single
Steyn to Hughes, 1 run angling across, guided down to third man, Hughes wanted two, he starts for the second but Hughes sends him back
Steyn to Smith, 1 run length ball on off stump, clipped towards deep square leg
Steyn to Hughes, 1 run short ball, pulled towards deep midwicket, takes care to keep that down
Steyn to Smith, no run looks to pull that away, it wasn't too short from Steyn, sneaks under Smith's bat and goes through to the keeper
Tahir to Hughes, 1 run full toss is driven towards long-on for a single

Tahir to Smith, OUT Smith's innings is over, Tahir gets the breakthrough, Smith skips down the crease and looks to power the ball through the off side, and gets a thick outside edge, de Kock hangs on to that one, just about, it came off de Kock's right thigh pad initially, de Kock kept his cool to latch on
Tahir to Maxwell, no run clipped towards midwicket
Tahir to Maxwell, no run defended down the pitch this time
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 run eased towards long-on for a single this time, Maxwell off the mark
Tahir to Hughes, 1 run length ball, flighted, Hughes sends this towards point
Steyn to Hughes, no run length ball just outside off, Hughes carves it towards backward point
Steyn to Hughes, 1 run short of length ball just outside off, guided down towards third man for a single
Steyn to Maxwell, 1 run short of length and angling in, tucked towards square leg
Steyn to Hughes, 1 run short of length ball is steered towards third man for a single
Steyn to Maxwell, no run shortish ball outside off, bottom edge as Maxwell looks to push the ball towards backward point, the ball bounces towards the keeper

Steyn to Maxwell, OUT the Powerplay has struck, as it usually does, Glenn Maxwell is gone, a short ball from Steyn, Maxwell goes for the pull, top edge and the ball goes high up, Steyn wants it, so does de Kock, who will take it? it is de Kock who gets it as Steyn stays away
McLaren to Hughes, 1 wide well outside off and that is called a wide
McLaren to Hughes, no run full and wide outside off, slapped towards point
McLaren to Hughes, 1 run length ball on the pads, clipped towards square leg
McLaren to Bailey, no run angling in, length ball is defended towards the bowler
McLaren to Bailey, no run pitched up and that is driven towards cover by Bailey
McLaren to Bailey, no run short of length ball, pitching just outside off, defended towards point
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run a good-looking drive towards sweeper cover to end the over
Steyn to Bailey, no run length ball outside off, squeezed towards backward point, this is turning out to be a poor Powerplay for Australia
Steyn to Bailey, no run short of length ball, heading for middle and off, defended from the crease towards the bowler
Steyn to Bailey, no run similar delivery, around off stump this time, defended from the crease
Steyn to Bailey, 1 run digs this one towards short cover, Bailey wants the run to get him off the mark, Faf du Plessis pounces on that one but Hughes is quick enough to beat the throw
Steyn to Hughes, FOUR runs the Hughes cut brings him runs again, he charges out and clobbers that past point for four, is there any ball to which he can't play the cut?
Steyn to Hughes, FOUR runs full ball on the pads, Hughes whips that away for four more, behind backward point square leg, good contact on that one to beat the man in the deep
McLaren to Bailey, no run pitched up and that is pushed towards mid-on by Bailey
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run length ball angling in towards middle, clipped towards backward square leg
McLaren to Hughes, 1 run short of length from round the wicket, guided towards third man

McLaren to Bailey, 1 run pitched up and heading towards the pads, patted towards wide mid-on for a tight single, the throw comes in as Bailey hurries through, de Villiers' throw though hits the umpire Russell Tiffin
McLaren to Hughes, no run leading edge as Hughes wanted to tuck that to the leg side, the ball pops up to the off side, but doesn't carry to extra cover
McLaren to Hughes, no run pitched up and outside off, driven towards point
Phangiso to Bailey, 1 run Phangiso given the final over of the Powerplay, Bailey pushes this towards mid-off for a single, it was a flighted, full delivery
Phangiso to Hughes, no run full ball from over the wicket, sweeps after stepping out of the crease, towards backward square
Phangiso to Hughes, no run pushed towards midwicket this time

Phangiso to Hughes, OUT Hughes couldn't get the previous two deliveries away, decides he has to go big now, takes on the man at long-on, it was a length ball that he wanted to club over the ropes, he can't get it as wide as he likes, picks out the fielder at long-on, this has been a disastrous Powerplay for Australia
Phangiso to Bailey, no run full ball is pushed towards point
Phangiso to Bailey, 1 run driven towards cover to end the over
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run eased towards long-on for a single
Tahir to Marsh, no run flighted delivery on the off stump, Marsh defends off the front foot
Tahir to Marsh, no run keeps bat and pad close as he blocks this to the off side
Tahir to Marsh, no run punches this one towards cover
Tahir to Marsh, no run length ball spinning away towards off, defended off the front foot
Tahir to Marsh, no run just one off the over as the final delivery is defended back towards the bowler
Phangiso to Bailey, no run defended to the off side from deep within the crease
Phangiso to Bailey, no run a touch short as he sees Bailey charge out, off the pads
Phangiso to Bailey, no run down the track again, eased towards cover

Phangiso to Bailey, 2 runs whoah! close call for Bailey, the outside edge as Phangiso flights the ball and gets it to turn, a thick edge past the keeper, no slip, and that's a fortunate two for Bailey
Phangiso to Bailey, no run defends this one with more confidence
Phangiso to Bailey, FOUR runs full and on the pads, put away past short fine leg, poor delivery that given the field set
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run length ball pitching outside off, driven towards long-off for a single
Tahir to Bailey, no run spins past the bat, off the pads as Bailey looks to work that to the leg side
Tahir to Bailey, no run pushed back towards the bowler
Tahir to Bailey, FOUR runs short and down the leg side, you expect a few of these poor deliveries from Tahir every now and then, Bailey gets it away fine, past fine leg for four
Tahir to Bailey, no run Bailey taps this one from the crease
Tahir to Bailey, no run short of length, pitching on off stump, not turning much, defended to the leg side
Morkel to Haddin, 1 run outside off on length, helped to third man easily for one
Morkel to Marsh, (no ball) 1 run too short outside off this time, pulled easily to deep midwicket
Morkel to Haddin, no run on length quite a bit outside off and Haddin pokes but misses
Morkel to Haddin, 1 run fuller this time and Haddin drives it easily to deep cover

Morkel to Marsh, FOUR runs it's a tad full from length outside off and Marsh has found the wide gap between deep cover and third man for a four. It was not a powerful drive, but timed very well past point
Morkel to Marsh, 1 run back of length outside off, runs it down to third man for one
Morkel to Haddin, no run short of length outside off, offcutter comes in as he defends it back
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run flat and just outside off, pushed off the back foot
Tahir to Haddin, 1 run flat and short on middle stump this time, pushed down to long-on for one
Tahir to Marsh, no run flighted and fuller, pushed back to the bowler
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run on length outside off, driven with the turn to sweeper cover to bring up Australia's 200
Tahir to Haddin, 1 run towards middle and leg, tapped off the back foot to the leg side
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run fuller on middle stump, pushed down the ground to long-on for one
Steyn to Marsh, no run swat and a miss! It wasn't a very short ball outside off but Marsh went for a slog targeting the cow corner boundary but missed completely
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run short ball angled in towards the batsman, he makes room and taps it to cover for a quick single
Steyn to Haddin, FOUR runs just wide of slip! It was on length outside off and Haddin cut it pretty late to run it down and Amla nearly got a hand to it with his dive to catch it. Goes for four
Steyn to Haddin, no run that's what Steyn is known for! This one was teasing the batsman just outside off and beat Haddin completely as he looked to defend
Steyn to Haddin, 1 run goes towards leg stump this time and Haddin tucks it off is pad to square leg
Steyn to Marsh, FOUR runs give his room and Marsh produces a superb drive! It was not a half-volley but Marsh stood his ground and drove it handsomely over the cover for a powerful four
Tahir to Haddin, 1 run googly to start the over and looks like Haddin picked it to play the slog-sweep but could not middle it, for one
Tahir to Marsh, no run comes down the track and is beaten by a sharp googly which came in from outside off
Tahir to Marsh, no run quicker delivery this time as Marsh looks to attack again and is beaten again
Tahir to Marsh, SIX runs he connects this time and goes all the away! Tahir pitched it fuller and Marsh took it on the full by coming down and launched it over long-on for six
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run quicker one on off stump, pushed down to long-on for one

Tahir to Haddin, no run oh, how was that? No, it's not an appeal! Haddin got into position early for a paddle sweep and Tahir offered a full toss close to Haddin's head, he was down on a knee, and he still swept it, but not for runs
Phangiso to Marsh, 1 run length ball heading for the pads, eased towards mid-off for a single
Phangiso to Bailey, 1 run flighted and full, driven towards long-off for one more
Phangiso to Marsh, 2 runs turn there for Phangiso, gets the edge as the ball zips away outside off, towards third man
Phangiso to Marsh, no run fuller one, driven to short extra cover
Phangiso to Marsh, no run waits on the back foot as he drives, can't find the gap near extra cover
Phangiso to Marsh, 1 run flighted delivery, turns away outside off, lofted drive towards sweeper cover to end the over
Duminy to Marsh, 1 run full on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
Duminy to Bailey, SIX runs comes down the track to charge and he gets the distance to loft it over long-n for six. He took it on the full and even tough there was a fielder in the deep
Duminy to Bailey, 2 runs full on leg stump, swept to deep fine leg for one
Duminy to Bailey, no run on length on middle stump, pushed off the back foot to midwicket
Duminy to Bailey, 1 run comes down again to take it on full and tucks it to deep midwicket
Duminy to Marsh, 1 run flighted outside off, drives it with width to deeper cover
Steyn to Marsh, SIX runs oh, another one from Marsh! He plays these straight shots too well and with great timing! It was on length outside off and he tonked it straight down the ground for maximum
Steyn to Marsh, SIX runs boom, another one! Steyn pitches it short to reply but Marsh swat-pulls it over long-on for one more six! He has some power
Steyn to Marsh, SIX runs and another, and this one makes Steyn smile! This might have been on length but it was too wide and Marsh smahed it over long-off this time. What's the result? SIX!
Steyn to Marsh, 2 runs too full and wide, Marsh chases and will this go for four? It's running to the third man boundary and the fielder there does well to save two runs
Steyn to Marsh, no run right on the money - yorker from Steyn and Marsh blocks it back
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run length delivery outside off, pushed away nicely to sweeper cover to keep strike and Marsh brings up his fifty
McLaren to Marsh, FOUR runs short and slightly outside off, it's swatted down the ground past the bowler by making room and oh it's gone for four! Long-on leaped to his left but could not stop it
McLaren to Marsh, SIX runs one more, it's gone all the way! You can't bowl full to him, it was offered there outside off and whether there's no fielder at long-off, but it goes all the way
McLaren to Marsh, 1 wide short ball this time but it's gone over his head for a wide

McLaren to Marsh, FOUR runs tries the yorker, and the full toss has been out away for four. Was on the pads and he flicked it away in the air and the ball nearly bounced over the fielder's head in the deep at midwicket
McLaren to Marsh, no run short ball with a scrambled seam outside off, he makes room and misses the pull
McLaren to Marsh, no run gets it right this time, one in the block hole well outside off and Marsh misses
McLaren to Marsh, 1 run slower ball and it's a wide full toss outside off, driven to deep point for one
Morkel to Marsh, no run short of length outside off, inside edge nearly drags onto the stumps, rolls away to the keeper
Morkel to Marsh, no run tries a drive and gets another inside edge, this was one thicker and went towards the bowler
Morkel to Marsh, 1 run width on offer and it's driven properly to sweeper cover now
Morkel to Bailey, no run teasing line and length outside off, Bailey pokes and misses
Morkel to Bailey, 1 run shorter outside off, Bailey slices it late to third man for one
Morkel to Marsh, no run fuller and wider, Marsh tries an extravagant drive and it swings away to beat him
Phangiso to Bailey, FOUR runs it's too short and Bailey rocks back to pull it behind square, finding the gap to the backward square leg boundary for a four

Phangiso to Bailey, OUT gone this time! He's been stumped, being beaten by the turn! Bailey charged down this time, despite hitting a four previous ball, going for a lofted drive for a ball on off stump but the ball turned away from him and QDK did the rest
Phangiso to Haddin, no run on length on off stump, he leans forward to defend
Phangiso to Haddin, no run touch shorter outside off, he goes back to punch it to cover, couldn't middle it

Phangiso to Haddin, no run nearly plays himself on! The ball was going just outside off from length and Haddin got an inside edge, it hit his pad but he panicked and kicked it away from him towards cover point
Phangiso to Haddin, 1 run slightly shorter to end the over, Haddin cuts it to deep point to keep strike
Morkel to Marsh, 1 run low full toss outside off, punched down to long-on for one
Morkel to Haddin, no run too wide outside off and full, Haddin gets closer to it and misses and it's not called a wide. The umpire signals to Haddin saying he moved too much to the off side

Morkel to Haddin, OUT Haddin falls in an attempt to collect runs like his partner. It was full outside off, he went for a lofted drive over the covers but got a leading edge and was caught at the edge of the circle
Morkel to Marsh, 1 run in the block hole and angled in, drives it down to long-on
Morkel to Johnson, 1 run slightly short of length outside off, pushed to cover to give strike to Marsh and it's a very risky single. But the fielder is deep in the circle and it's not a direct hit
Morkel to Marsh, (no ball) FOUR runs he gets on strike and smashes a four! Got a full toss over waist height, it's called a no ball, and finds the gap behind square on the leg side for four
Morkel to Marsh, 1 run full just outside off, driven down to long on and he keeps strike
McLaren to Marsh, 1 run slower and nearly in the block hole outside off, it's a low full toss and it's driven to sweeper cover for one
McLaren to Johnson, 1 run another full toss outside off, pushed straight to cover but AB fumbles to collect it on first attempt

McLaren to Marsh, SIX runs you can't get away all the time with full tosses! Third in a row and this is tonked over the long-off boundary for one more six! Doesn't matter to Marsh if there's a fielder in the deep or not

McLaren to Marsh, SIX runs two in a row! MacLaren pitched it shorter outside off and he slapped it over the midwicket boundary this time. they have either pitched it up or too short to him and this is six more

McLaren to Marsh, 1 run, OUT excellent ball in the block hole, but Johnson's been run out for trying to run the second. Marsh dug it down to long-off and nearly lost his balance while playing the shot which and he lost time there. Johnson wanted to get Marsh back on strike but he was sent back and he could not get there on time
McLaren to Starc, 1 run full delivery and it's driven down the ground to long-off for one to end the innings. Still got 16 from that over

That man has taken Australia to a very good score on this pitch. It's a bit slow but not turning much, like Marsh said. Australia scored 101 in the last 10 overs, all thanks to Marsh's unbeaten 86. They were going steady till about 150, led by Hughes' fifty but the Powerplay hurt their progress and were in trouble. But Marsh turned it around in their favour and has given himself and other bowlers

1.07pm Mitchell Marsh: [Feeling] not too bad. I have to give myself a chance, I like to hang around a bit and have a go at the end. I'm happy to be contributing to the team as a youngster and keep going. Pitch is not turning as much. We'll look to start well with early wickets and hopefully we'll get a win today.
1.30pm The players have come out a bit early for the chase. Hashim Amla will face Mitchell Johnson
Johnson to Amla, no run fullish and outside off, left easily by Amla
Johnson to Amla, no run swinging in from length form outside off, Amla drives it firmly to cover
Johnson to Amla, 1 run on the stumps this time, Amla goes back and turns it past midwicket

Johnson to de Kock, no run he hits middle stump, but with the return throw! De kock defended the length ball back to the bowler and was outside the crease and Johnson threw the ball back, it hit the batsman and uprooted the middle stump
Johnson to de Kock, 1 run swinging in from length outside off, QDK helps it towards midwicket for one
Johnson to Amla, 1 run short of length on leg stump, he hops back to tuck it to square leg for one
Maxwell to Amla, 5 wide Maxwell starts with a wide way down the leg side, too wide for Haddin as well, and that is five free runs
Maxwell to Amla, 1 run full ball is driven towards long-on for a single
Maxwell to de Kock, no run Maxwell fires it towards the pads from round the wicket, defended to the leg side
Maxwell to de Kock, no run full and wide, de Kock skips down the pitch and thumps it towards cover, can't beat the infield
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run spins in towards off, Faf defends from the crease
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run bounces outside off, Faf looks to cut but misses
Johnson to Amla, no run Johnson bangs it back of a length, blocked back towards the bowler
Johnson to Amla, 3 runs shortish and outside off, pulls it away towards deep midwicket, not very well timed, and it was in the air for a bit, but enough on it to clear midwicket
Johnson to du Plessis, no run full and angling across, Faf shoulders arms to that one
Johnson to du Plessis, no run full and wide outside off, pushed towards cover
Johnson to du Plessis, no run short of length ball on off stump, defended down the track
Johnson to du Plessis, FOUR runs superb stroke from Faf to end the over, punched that between cover and extra cover for four, not much wrong with the delivery from Johnson, but he still concedes four
Kane Richardson to Amla, no run short of length ball on off stump, defended by Amla
Kane Richardson to Amla, FOUR runs length ball wide outside off, Amla latches on to that one, lashes it through the cover for four, too easy for Amla this
Kane Richardson to Amla, no run Amla shoulders arms to this one, which is closer to off and a touch shorter
Kane Richardson to Amla, no run length ball way outside off stump, Amla is happy to let that one through to the keeper
Kane Richardson to Amla, no run angling in towards off stump, back of a length ball, Amla defends from the crease
Kane Richardson to Amla, no run fuller and heading for middle and leg, Amla tucks this a touch awkwardly towards midwicket
Johnson to du Plessis, no run short of length and just outside off, defended from the crease
Johnson to du Plessis, no run angling across, left alone by Faf
Johnson to du Plessis, no run short of length ball is mistimed towards mid-off
Johnson to du Plessis, no run short ball, just down the leg side, batsman ducks under it
Johnson to du Plessis, no run full ball on off stump, pushed towards covers
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run Faf just gets the bat down in time, inside-edged towards square leg, an appeal for lbw, a quick single is taken
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run opens the face as he blocks the ball towards point, it was on a length and outside off
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run outside off, Faf happy to allow it through to the keeper
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run even wider, just within the legal limit, another leave
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 1 run taps this to backward point, straight towards the fielder but played with soft hands, time there for a single
Kane Richardson to Amla, FOUR runs full and outside off, lofted cover drive from Amla, again he doesn't exactly middle it, but he again gets enough on it clear the man in the ring
Kane Richardson to Amla, no run length ball on off stump, Amla gets forward and defends
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run again Faf not at his most convincing against Johnson, an inside edge down to fine leg, Johnson has his hands on his head, that could have easily taken leg stump
Johnson to Amla, no run this time it just misses the inside edge as Amla looks to drive away from his body, no foot work either
Johnson to Amla, no run short ball heading for Amla's head, Amla looks to hook that but misses, through to the keeper, a mild appeal for caught behind
Johnson to Amla, no run Johnson bowling a superb over here, a full ball now, Amla is pegged back in the crease and he manages to dig that out
Johnson to Amla, no run punched down the ground off the back foot, but not wide enough of mid-off
Johnson to Amla, 2 runs full ball just outside off, lovely work from Amla, shuffling across the stumps and clipping it down towards fine leg
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run length ball heading for off stump, defended by Faf to the leg side
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, FOUR runs Faf! that is an awesome shot, a touch short, it sits up, Faf flat bats that over extra cover for four, Faf just dismissed that one
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run pitched up and that is driven towards mid-off this time

Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 1 run back of a length ball, Faf opens the face to steer the ball towards backward point, 'Yes, yes, yes,' he shouts to Amla, calling him through for the single, though Maxwell makes a diving stop
Kane Richardson to Amla, 1 run shortish and outside off, dabbed to third man for an ambled single
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run shortish and outside off, Faf looks to chop that through the off, thick bottom edge as the ball bounces past the keeper
Starc to Amla, no run length ball outside off, defended towards short cover by Amla
Starc to Amla, no run superbly timed drive from Amla, but straight to mid-off, so no run
Starc to Amla, no run Amla looks to power this through the off, a back of a length ball outside off, he can't beat backward point
Starc to Amla, no run length ball on middle and leg, patted towards mid-on
Starc to Amla, no run driven towards point this time, Amla still can't get it away for runs
Starc to Amla, no run a maiden despite several attempts at form strokes, this one is driven on the up to short cover
Marsh to du Plessis, no run starts with a length ball on off stump, guided towards point
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run again on a length, around off and middle, pushed towards extra cover for a quick single

Marsh to Amla, OUT stunning take from Haddin, throwing himself to his left to pluck a one-handed take, not bad for a 36-year-old that, Amla had moved across the stumps to try whip the ball down to fine leg, can only tickle it just wide of Haddin, or so he thought till that acrobatic leap from Haddin, and Marsh's day continues to get better
Marsh to de Villiers, no run length ball on middle stump, AB de Villiers defends it back towards the bowler
Marsh to de Villiers, no run length ball on the pads, defended to the leg side
Marsh to de Villiers, no run short of length ball outside off, AB taking a couple of paces down the track, defended to the off side this time
Starc to du Plessis, no run length ball on off stump, blocked to the off side
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run fuller and outside off, guides this towards deep backward point
Starc to de Villiers, no run driven towards mid-on this time, straight at the fielder
Starc to de Villiers, no run length ball is driven towards mid-off this time, AB middling it but not finding the gaps
Starc to de Villiers, no run blocked towards point by AB de Villiers
Starc to de Villiers, no run pitched up and heading down the leg side, big appeal for lbw but there was little chance of that being given, don't think it pitched in line either
Marsh to du Plessis, no run Faf walks down the track and flat bats it towards mid-on
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs what a shot that is, comes down the track and flat bats a shortish ball over the bowler's head, lifts his back leg as he powers the ball towards the sightscreen
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run this time the ball is quicker on to him than he expected, hit high on the blade as he looks to pull, sends it towards deep midwicket
Marsh to de Villiers, 1 run dinked towards third man for a single

Marsh to du Plessis, SIX runs and a repeat from Faf, this is another outstanding hit, takes a couple of steps down the track, gets near the pitch, lofts this over mid-off for six, again the exaggerated lift of the back foot, this isn't the most quickest of surfaces, which allows for this sort of shot
Marsh to du Plessis, no run full ball outside off, Faf considers whether to whack this as well, then let's it goo
Starc to de Villiers, no run mistimes it as he looks to scythe it through cover
Starc to de Villiers, 1 run short of length ball on leg stump, nudged towards deep backward square leg to bring up South africa's 50
Starc to du Plessis, no run full and just outside off, driven towards mid-off off the front foot
Starc to du Plessis, 2 runs short and wide, hit low on the bat but gets enough on it to clear the infield, over cover point
Starc to du Plessis, no run the yorker, on middle and leg, squeezed out to the right of the bowler
Starc to du Plessis, no run goes for the pull, was there a bottom edge there? doesn't matter as it bounces to the keeper, Starc smiles at the batsmen seeing the shot attempted and the result
Lyon to de Villiers, no run length ball, defended off the front foot to the off side
Lyon to de Villiers, 1 run pitched up and outside off, a bit of an edge towards cover, fielder puts in a dive but he can't make a clean stop
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run full ball, du Plessis had decided in advance that he was going to lap sweep that, he does for a single
Lyon to de Villiers, no run length ball is driven towards extra cover by de Villiers
Lyon to de Villiers, 1 run whips a full ball towards long-on
Lyon to du Plessis, no run huge shout for lbw as Faf again looks to lap sweep, did that pitch in line? not sure it did
Starc to de Villiers, no run length ball on middle and leg, defended from the crease
Starc to de Villiers, 1 run full and well outside off, jabbed towards cover for a single
Starc to du Plessis, FOUR runs du Plessis' innings seems to consist of only one boundary-hitting shot, once more he skips out of the crease, thumps this over mid-off for four more
Starc to du Plessis, 2 runs full and heading for off stump, driven towards extra cover, not fielded cleanly there allowing for the second
Starc to du Plessis, no run full and outside off, Faf doesn't offer a stroke
Starc to du Plessis, no run full and just outside off once more, driven firmly towards cover
Lyon to de Villiers, 1 run Lyon continues from round the wicket, spinning down the leg side, tucked towards midwicket
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run down the track as he pushes the ball towards square leg
Lyon to de Villiers, no run swept firmly towards square leg

Lyon to de Villiers, OUT swept once more, this time in the air, taken at backward square leg, perhaps AB wanted to hit that over the fielder there, but instead he hits it straight at his chest, easy for Bailey, a massive wicket this, South Africa in a hole now, with their three most prolific batsmen in recent series gone, this is a test for middle and lower-middle order
Lyon to Duminy, no run bit of turn outside off from length, Duminy defends off the back foot
Lyon to Duminy, 1 run full outside off, JPD drives it down past cover to get off the mark
Kane Richardson to Duminy, no run from outside leg, tucked off the back foot to midwicket
Kane Richardson to Duminy, no run short of length from outside leg again, he defends it back to the bowler
Kane Richardson to Duminy, no run on length and angling away form outside off, drives it to short cover
Kane Richardson to Duminy, no run towards off stump this time, he defends it back
Kane Richardson to Duminy, 1 run back to the leg stump line, runs it down to fine leg for one
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 1 run touch short of length and Faf stays back to whip it off his pads to square leg for one
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run flighted around off, Faf paddle-sweeps it to short fine leg for one
Lyon to Duminy, no run on length with some turn, JPD defends with soft hands on the off side
Lyon to Duminy, no run short of length on middle and turning away, JPD goes back and defends on the leg side
Lyon to Duminy, no run similar length on the off stump, he goes back again to defend after the turn
Lyon to Duminy, no run flighted on middle stump, pushes it back to the bowler
Lyon to Duminy, 1 run flighted and full on the of stump, drives it down to long-off for one
Kane Richardson to Duminy, 1 run on length and angling away from outside off, helps it to third man for one
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run back of length outside off, punched off the back foot on the off side
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 1 run back of length and angling in, sliced to third man late by Faf
Kane Richardson to Duminy, no run on length on middle and leg, defends it back to the bowler, bit of extra bounce there
Kane Richardson to Duminy, 1 run shorter and a bit wider outside off, cuts it late to third man for one
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run back of length and towards the stumps, Faf defends it back
Lyon to Duminy, no run flighted on middle stump on length, he goes back and defends on the off side
Lyon to Duminy, no run flighted on the leg stump now, turned straight to backward square leg
Lyon to Duminy, no run fuller on off, takes a step down to push it to midwicket
Lyon to Duminy, 1 run tossed up on middle and off, drives it down to long-off easily

Lyon to du Plessis, FOUR runs comes down the pitch and makes it a full toss to drive it in the gap through the covers for four. Nobody in the deep and he found the gap pretty well, taking one hand off the bat towards the end
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run takes a step down again and tucks the ball to deep midwicket for one
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run short ball and it's pulled straight to deep square leg after a bounce
Marsh to Duminy, no run short of length from middle and swinging away, defends off the back foot towards cover point

Marsh to Duminy, no run touch shorter outside off, taps it off the back foot to point. Maxwell grabbed the ball there and tried a direct hit at the non-striker's end, had it hit Faf would have been out
Marsh to Duminy, 2 runs outside leg now and it's helped to deep fine leg, a bit wide actually, and they run quickly for two
Marsh to Duminy, no run length delivery on middle and off, JPD defends it back
Marsh to Duminy, 2 runs back of length on the pads, turned to deep midwicket. The fielder is so deep they come back for two
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run full on middle and leg, flicked in the air past midwicket for one
Maxwell to Duminy, FOUR runs comes down the track and whips it against the turn from outside off just over midwicket for four in the gap
Maxwell to Duminy, 1 run flighted just outside off, pushed towards point for one
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run flatter on off stump, paddle-swept to fine leg by Faf
Maxwell to Duminy, no run on length just outside off, swishes it to backward point

Maxwell to Duminy, 1 leg bye loud appeal for lbw, but not given! JPD went back a long way for this one that pitched on middle and it didn't turn, was going with the angle, but when it hit JPD on the back foot, the leg stump was visible. A very lucky Duminy also got a leg bye
Marsh to Duminy, no run length delivery on middle stump is defended back
Marsh to Duminy, no run on length on off now, he stays back to defend it again
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run back of length outside off, gives JPD time to run it down to third man
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run handsome drive from Faf for the full delivery outside off, but there's a fielder in the deep
Marsh to du Plessis, no run swinging in a bit, it as almost in the block hole on off, Faf digs it out
Maxwell to Miller, 1 wide goes down the leg side with the angle for a wide
Maxwell to Miller, 3 runs on length outside off, pushed past point gently but it's well in the gap and they have time to come back for three
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run length delivery on off stump, he defends it back
Maxwell to du Plessis, 2 runs flighted outside leg and it's paddle swept fine on the leg side, they come back for two
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up on off stump, driven down the ground to long-off and that brings up his fifty
Maxwell to Miller, no run length delivery outside off, pushed to cover and that's the first time Miller has played more than a ball in this series
Maxwell to Miller, no run brings it in with the angle from off, Miller goes back and defends on the off side
Johnson to du Plessis, no run short of length and angled in, he defends it back
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run short of length from outside off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
Johnson to Miller, no run length delivery around off stump, Miller defends it back
Johnson to McLaren, 1 leg bye stifled appeal as Johnson tries a yorker but it's going down leg and the ball goes down to fine leg after hitting McLaren's foot
Johnson to du Plessis, no run back of length from outside off, nearly whipped, but he defends it to midwicket
Lyon to McLaren, no run bit of flight on length outside off, he defends by leaning forward
Lyon to McLaren, no run touch fuller and it's pushed towards cover point where the fielder gets to it in a flash and sends McLaren back
Lyon to McLaren, 1 run fuller on leg stump, tucked off the pads to deep midwicket
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run short of length on middle and leg, tapped off the back foot to deep midwicket
Lyon to McLaren, no run flighted outside off, driven off the front foot to short cover
Lyon to McLaren, no run length delivery on middle and off, taps it to point with the turn
Johnson to du Plessis, no run length delivery from wide of the crease, it's full and Faf guides it to point
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run on length outside off again, he rolled his fingers over this one which made it slow and Faf gets a thick edge to third man
Johnson to McLaren, 1 wide tries the yorker, it's too quick and goes down leg for a wide. Good take by Haddin
Johnson to McLaren, 1 run towards middle and leg this time, tucked with the angle to the leg side
Johnson to du Plessis, no run angled in sharply towards middle stump on length, Faf blocks it
Johnson to du Plessis, 2 runs he takes a step down for the short ball and adjusts well to pull it to deep midwicket in the gap for two
Johnson to du Plessis, no run angled in towards the batsman, it's gone to midwicket after a thick inside edge
Lyon to McLaren, 1 run slow through the air outside off, pushed off the back foot towards cover

Lyon to du Plessis, no run Haddin ran a long way towards leg gully to catch that! Faf tried the paddle sleep and Haddin ran early in anticipation but it fell just outside his reach after going off the bat and pad
Lyon to du Plessis, no run goes with the angle, doesn't turn as Faf goes back and defends it on the back foot outside off stump
Lyon to du Plessis, FOUR runs flighted on middle and Faf middles it this time, and in the gap! Went down on a knee and slept it with the turn to the backward square leg boundary
Lyon to du Plessis, no run takes a step down and takes it on the pad outside off
Lyon to du Plessis, FOUR runs outside off this time and Faf has enough time to sweep it again to the wide gap between fine leg and midwicket for another four!
Johnson to McLaren, no run tries another yorker and he hits McLaren's pad outside the leg stump with a full delivery

Johnson to McLaren, no run oh, what pace can do! McLaren is hit on the arm this time, it was a short delivery towards the batsman, he hardly had time to react and ducked a bit, taking his eyes off the ball, which hit him on the arm
Johnson to McLaren, no run solid defence this time for the delivery outside off on length

Johnson to McLaren, no run loud lbw appeal as he's hit on the back pad for the ball that was angled in from outside off. The ball might have been a bit too high as Aleem Dar didn't react much. Not much footwork from the batsman
Johnson to McLaren, no run fuller on middle and leg, pushed down the ground to mid-on
Johnson to McLaren, no run beaten again as the ball comes in towards the pad, he looked to flick it off the pad but missed and the ball strayed to the off side
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run a bit of flight on middle and leg, tucked off the pad to square leg
Lyon to McLaren, 1 run short and wide outside off and there's enough time for him to go back and punch it to sweeper cover
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run turning in from just outside off, Faf goes back and helps it with the turn to fine leg
Lyon to McLaren, no run flighted on middle and it's pushed back to the bowler, nearly carried to the bowler
Lyon to McLaren, 1 run quicker one towards leg stump and it goes towards point after an edge
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run full on off stump, drives it down to long-on to end the over
Starc to du Plessis, SIX runs what a shot! Scintillating shot from Faf as he came down the track and took it on the full to loft it very high and long over long-on for a massive six
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run much closer to middle and leg, tucked off the back foot towards midwicket
Starc to McLaren, no run full and just outside off, pushed down to mid-off off the front foot
Starc to McLaren, 1 run cutting in a little bit from off, turned to square leg for one
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run tries a yorker, it's a low full toss on off stump, pushed down to long-off for one
Starc to McLaren, 2 runs angled in towards the batsman's pads, it's tucked to fine leg where a fumble gives them a chance for the second
Lyon to du Plessis, no run bit of flight on middle stump, turned to midwicket
Lyon to du Plessis, 2 runs flighted on off this time and Faf does what he does very well, paddle sweeps it fine on the leg side for two
Lyon to du Plessis, 2 runs tries another paddle sweep and nearly yorks himself, he pulled out at the end and dug it out towards backward square leg
Lyon to du Plessis, 3 runs he's not going to stop them - another paddle sweep and this time they get three because of a fumble at fine leg by Steven Smith

Lyon to McLaren, FOUR runs straight down the ground and that's a handsome one from McLaren! It was full on off and he drove it down the ground, with a straight bat over the bowler's head for a four. There's nobody in the deep
Lyon to McLaren, no run leans forward this time to defend the length delivery
Starc to du Plessis, no run angled in from round the wicket, Faf defends it to the off side
Starc to du Plessis, no run on length and well outside off, Faf looked to tap it but the ball held its line and bounced a bit extra
Starc to du Plessis, no run takes a step down and defends the length ball back to the bowler
Starc to du Plessis, SIX runs charges down the ground and that's a powerful and flat six! He came down and took the ball as a half-volley to smash it over the bowler's head for a flat six
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run responds with a short ball and it's pulled to deep midwicket
Starc to McLaren, 1 run swinging in from outside off, McLaren defends and an inside edge goes close to leg stump after hitting the pad and they take a quick single
Lyon to McLaren, 1 run whipping it against the turn from outside off, it chips in the air between cover point and point for one
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run flighted just outside off, tapped to square leg with the turn for one
Lyon to McLaren, no run beaten! McLaren's defence is beaten with the turn after it pitched outside off and Haddin whips the bails too, but his back foot is in the crease
Lyon to McLaren, no run tries a slog sweep this time for this one that pitched outside off, missed it again
Lyon to McLaren, no run fuller on middle and off, it's pushed straight to cover
Lyon to McLaren, 1 run tossed up even more on middle stump, pushed down firmly to long-off past Lyon
Marsh to McLaren, 1 run length delivery around off stump, taps it close on the pitch on the leg stump and calls for a single early
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run just wide of short midwicket! Marsh pitched it up towards leg stump, making Faf flick and it went to the left of a diving short midwicket
Marsh to McLaren, no run stays back and defends the length ball back to the bowler
Marsh to McLaren, no run tries to drive the full delivery outside off but can't middle it
Marsh to McLaren, no run short of length on middle stump and he looked to whip it on the leg side, but got an inside edge on his thigh pad
Marsh to McLaren, 1 run fuller outside off, pushed with the angle to sweeper cover for one
Lyon to McLaren, 1 run drifts it in towards middle stump from outside off, turned away to midwicket for one
Lyon to du Plessis, 1 run Faf goes back in the crease for the ball to turn and tucks it to backward square leg
Lyon to McLaren, no run loud appeal for lbw as McLaren tries the reverse sweep! the ball pitched on leg stump and turned towards middle, was probably high but it looked close
Lyon to McLaren, 1 run fuller on leg stump, driven down to long-on for one
Lyon to du Plessis, no run goes to the back foot for the ball that comes towards off stump, he defends towards short cover

Lyon to du Plessis, SIX runs makes room and Faf plays those very well! He moved way outside leg stump early and cashed in on the full delivery, it was full too, and executed a stunning inside-out lofted drive over long-off for six. Moves to 97 now
Kane Richardson to McLaren, no run angled in towards the batsman who defends it back
Kane Richardson to McLaren, 1 run fuller outside of and it's turned with the wrists to mid-on
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 1 run short of length and coming in, tapped to backward point late off the back foot
Kane Richardson to McLaren, FOUR runs top edge goes for four! He banged it in for a bouner and McLaren hooked and managed a thick top edge just down the leg side for four
Kane Richardson to McLaren, no run on length from outside off, pushed to cover this time
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run bangs it in from wide of the crease, round the wicket, tapped towards backward point. Steyn on strike straightaway
Starc to Steyn, no run the bounce surprises Steyn! Starc pitched it short of length from outside off and Steyn thought it was a bouncer, swaying away, and defended it awkwardly
Starc to Steyn, no run back of length outside off, he defends it towards cover point
Starc to Steyn, 4 leg byes strays down the leg side, it was full too, and goes fine off the pad on the leg side, just beating a diving Haddin
Starc to Steyn, 1 run back of length well outside off, tapped without any footwork to third man

Starc to du Plessis, 1 run bouncer outside off and Faf pulls it softly past midwicket for one to bring up his second ODI hundred, both against Australia in this series. Punches the air and gets a hug from Dale Steyn

Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run nearly loses his off stump! Takes a step down to smash it on the leg side but misses it completely and the short of length ball that came in almost kissed the top of off stump
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, FOUR runs makes room and gets a full toss too! What does he do, lofts it pretty easily over the covers for four. It's the Powerplay so nobody's in the deep
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run makes room again, he pitches it short of length and Faf struck it powerfully but straight to cover point at the edge of the circle
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 1 run nearly played on now! Tries to force the wide delivery outside off through the covers but gets an inside edge just past the stumps
Kane Richardson to Steyn, FOUR runs he can bat too! Steyn clears his front foot out of the way and smashes the length delivery through the covers for a four
Kane Richardson to Steyn, no run much shorter and slower outside off, Steyn tries a pull and misses this time

Starc to du Plessis, SIX runs on the leg side this time, will he be caught, no it goes all the way! Short of length and angled in towards leg stump, Faf crashed it to the midwicket boundary even though there was a fielder there

Starc to du Plessis, SIX runs and another! He's doing a Mitchell Marsh here! Fuller from Starc and he tonked this one over the long-on boundary. He either connects them for six, or misses them. Nothing in between
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run slow bouncer outside off, swats it down to long-on for one
Starc to Steyn, 1 leg bye he goes way down the leg side and Starc chases him, gets hit on the pad for a leg bye
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run pulled again, with some power, and this short ball goes to deep midwicket after a bounce
Starc to Steyn, no run swinging yorker on middle and leg, Steyn blocks it back
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run slightly slow and full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on for one
Johnson to Steyn, no run put down, but that was a very tough chance! The short of length ball on leg was slapped back to Johnson who barely had any time to react but got his left hand to it
Johnson to du Plessis, 2 runs angled towards the leg stump, helped off the back foot wide of short fine leg for two
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 wide slow and wide outside off, left by the batsman for a side even though Faf tried to chase it
Johnson to du Plessis, 2 runs makes room to loft it over the covers but the ball comes slower than expected and the bat turns in his hand, the ball goes in the air towards long-on

Johnson to du Plessis, no run keeps low and oh, nearly a run out! The inside edge went to short fine leg and Phangiso wanted the single but Faf didn't know where the ball went. He realised it was too risky and sent Phangiso back and the throw wasn't accurate to run him out
Kane Richardson to Phangiso, no run on length well outside off, tapped straight to cover point
Kane Richardson to Phangiso, 1 run short of length outside off, runs it down to third man for one
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 2 runs outside off and Faf stays back to whip it to deep midwicket, who's pretty deep and he called early for two
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run makes room again and he survives again! He went a long way down leg to push the short of length ball on off, he missed and the ball also missed the stumps

Kane Richardson to du Plessis, OUT oh, he's hitwicket, what a way for that innings to end! Faf went back in the crease to turn the ball to deep midwicket from outside off and set off for a single too, but his right heel touched the base of the off stump and he has to walk back. He has a word with Phangiso before leaving the field
Kane Richardson to Morkel, no run short of length outside off, pushed down to mid-off off the back foot

Johnson to Phangiso, no run that lands in no man's land! It was a bouncer from Johnson, the pull came a little late and a top edge went high towards the backward short leg area, the keeper ran, square leg ran but it fell in the middle
Johnson to Phangiso, no run short again, tapped to the leg side off the toes
Johnson to Phangiso, 1 run fuller on the stumps, pushed down to mid-on for one
Johnson to Morkel, 1 wide bangs it in short from wide of the crease and that's gone over Morkel's head for a wide
Johnson to Morkel, 1 wide another wide - this one down the leg side and Haddin does very well to save four more extra runs with his right hand
Johnson to Tahir, no run brings this one in sharply from outside off, thick outside edge goes to the off side
Johnson to Tahir, 1 run angled in towards the leg stump, it's tucked towards midwicket for a single
Maxwell to Tahir, 1 run short on the pads, the batsman moves back and tucks it behind square
Maxwell to Phangiso, no run defended on the back foot towards the bowler
Maxwell to Phangiso, no run not short enough to cut but he tries it anyway, ends up playing it awkwardly on the off side
Maxwell to Phangiso, no run defended towards midwicket
Maxwell to Phangiso, 1 run the length is short once again, the batsman goes back and works the ball through midwicket

4.50pm A bonus-point win means Australia have made it to the series final, despite losing to Zimbabwe a couple of days ago. They were jittery today as well but Hughes and Marsh charged them to a very competitive score on this pitch. Their bowlers never allowed South Africa to get on top. No batsman could even score 25, barring du Plessis who ran out of partners before falling for 126. Most of the
That's all we have for you today, so Zimbabwe can still make it to the final. Do join us for that match on Thursday when they play South Africa for a bonus-point win. It's goodbye from Vishal, ta ta!
Presentation time:
Australia won by 62 runs
Player of the match is Mitchell Marsh, AUS
